content: stash bustin tote skill level size approx 13-1/2 wide x 10 high materials stash yarns sample tote was made with worsted & dk-wt yarns -- about 800 yds total holding 3 strands as one crochet hook size n/15 10 mm or size needed to achieve gauge tapestry needle gauge 7 5 sts = 4 5 5 row = 4 in half_double_crochet worked in the round on size n/15 10 mm hook pattern notes bag is worked in seamless circular crochet method beginning at base and ending at top slip_stitch join occurs at end of each round and a chain-up begins each new round do not turn at each of each round but continue in same direction on every round terms/abbreviations beginning beg chain chain double_crochet double_crochet each ea group grp hook hk loop lp repeat repeat single_crochet single_crochet skip skip slip_stitch slip_stitch space space stitch st tote with 3 strands of yarn chain 50 join into ring be careful not to twist chain round 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet in ea chain around join with slip_stitch do not turn 50 half_double_crochet round 2 chain 2 half_double_crochet in ea half_double_crochet around join with slip_stitch do not turn 50 half_double_crochet 1 rnds 3-14 repeat round 2 as you use up a strand of yarn or decide to change color replace it with another strand in a similar but darker shade keep changing one of the strands in the color sequence you have laid out light to dark dark to light or any sequence you please at each yarn change lay the tails along top of round and work over them to avoid having to weave in later at end of round 14 join with slip_stitch turn bag inside out holding bag flat and with right sides together slip_stitch across through both thicknesses to close bottom of bag fasten_off and weave in ends top edging attach 3 strands of yarn to top of bag on opposite side of beg chain round 1 chain 1 single_crochet evenly around skip a stitch or two or decrease a couple times if you want the top of bag to draw in a bit join with slip_stitch 47 single_crochet on sample bag round 2 chain 1 single_crochet evenly around join with slip_stitch fasten_off and weave in ends handles make 2 leaving a 12 tail at beginning with 3 strands of yarn chain 50 slip_stitch back in ea chain across then cut yarn leaving 12 tail use hook to pull ends of chain through top of bag between rnds 1 & 2 of top edging and 7 sts in from each side join ends of chain into a circle by tying tails from beg end of chain to other end of chain weave in tails copyright 2017 2007 kathy north www ravelry com/designers/kathy-north for personal or charity use only do not duplicate pattern for commercial purposes 2
